intro: Habracanthus laxus, commonly known as the slender habracanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
